template.p: Use the CRM app to track and manage all necessary contacts, enabling you to generate a professional quotation. From the quotation, you can use the built-in quote calculator to determine a fixed price for each product. This method allows you to offer generic products with a customized price based on each customer's specific needs.

span.strong: Creating a Sales Order from the CRM

template.p: To begin, open the CRM app and follow these steps to create a new sales order.

li.p: Click "Create" to start a new opportunity.
Choose the customer from your list. If they're a new client, you can add their information directly in the customer field.
Use the chatter feature to communicate with the client and accurately determine their requirements.
Once you understand their needs, generate a quotation from the opportunity.
Select a quotation template, add the necessary products and any extra services.
Use the quote calculator to price each product based on the customer's specifications. The product tabs are organized by their sequence on the sales lines.
For complex projects, add the "Project Management" service to track the quotation within a dedicated project.
Update the delivery date to ensure your deadlines are met and deliveries are scheduled correctly.
Send the final quotation to the client, making sure to attach any plans from your drawing software.

template.p: The Manufacturing app is your central hub for production management. Its main purpose is to automatically generate all the necessary sub-assemblies and purchase orders linked to your production needs.

ul.li: Create the necessary products, you'll need to choose its route in the Inventory Tab. This determines how the product will be restocked. You have two main options:

li.p: Buy: Select this if the product is purchased from a vendor.
Manufacture: Choose this if the product is made in-house.

ul.p: You can also activate "Replenish on Order (MTO)". This route automatically generates a new Purchase Order or Production Order every time an item is needed.
ul.li: For each product you want to purchase, add a vendor in the purchase tab (mandatory to have at least one)
For each product you want to produce, create a BIll Of Material and leave it empty. This way you will always manually add the needed components after the Sales Order is created.

li.p: Inventory Tracking: In this database, we've decided not to track products using a Warehouse Management System, even though Odoo offers this feature. While inventory tracking improves stock accuracy and forecasting, it also requires more administrative tasks to ensure all operations are validated on time. If you wish to implement inventory tracking, you can find more information in the official documentation.Inventory tracking

ul.li: Production Guidance: If you have employees on the shop floor who need guidance on manufacturing processes, consider exploring the Work Order feature and Shopfloor application. They are designed to provide operational support and instructions for your team. See documentation about it if you want to implement.Work Orders

template.p: There are two ways to manage production orders, depending on how you've configured your products.

ul.li: Automatic Creation from a Sales Order

If you've configured a manufactured product with the "Replenish on Order" and "Manufacturing" routes ‚Äãand a blank Bill of Materials (BOM), a smart button will appear on the Sales Order once it's confirmed. This button will automatically redirect you to the new production order, streamlining your workflow.
For other cases, or for manual follow-up, open the Manufacturing Order app. The main dashboard ‚Äã‚Äãprovides a clear overview of all outstanding production orders.

template.p: To manage a specific order, follow these steps:

li.p: Open the Manufacturing Order and add the necessary components.
Use the "Catalog" button to easily add products to the lines.

For any components you need to generate a sub-assembly or a purchase order, make sure the "Replenish on Order" route is set. Other items can be added to the BOM for informational or cost-calculation purposes only.
Adjust the scheduled date (when you plan to start) and the deadline (when it needs to be completed, based on the Sales Order's delivery date).
Click Validate.
This action automatically creates all necessary purchase orders and sub-assembly production orders.

template.p: On the Manufacturing overview, the "Available" status for an order will only turn green (labeled MO Ready in the filters) once all required purchased items have been received in your stock and all sub-assemblies have been produced. Otherwise, it will remain yellow (labeled MO Pending in the filters).

ul.li: Start by creating all your vendors
Then list the products and services you plan to buy in Odoo. Make sure to link each product to its specific vendor and price on the purchase tab.
Remember, the app only generates a receipt for physical goods, not for services.

template.p: There are two main ways to create purchase orders, based on how you've set up your products:

li.p: Automatic Creation:

If a product is configured with "Replenish on Order" and "Buy" routes, a purchase order is automatically generated from a sales or manufacturing order. After confirming the sales or manufacturing order, a smart button will appear, redirecting you to a new Request for Quotation (RFQ). You can make any necessary changes before confirming it.
Manual Management:
For all other scenarios, you can create and manage purchase orders directly in the Purchase app. The main dashboard provides a clear overview of all your orders.

template.p: To manage a specific purchase order, follow these steps:

li.p: Create a purchase order and add the products and services you need.
Combine RFQs: If you have multiple requests for quotation (RFQs) from the same vendor, you can group them into a single order.
Adjust the expected arrival date as needed.
Validate the order to confirm it.

template.p: From the Inventory App, you can adapt and validate all receipts or deliveries.

The main Dashboard gives you a real-time overview of all receipts and deliveries, showing which are on time and which are late. You can send reminders to vendors or updates to clients to ensure live, accurate tracking.
To manage a transfer:

li.p: Open the specific receipt or delivery.
If the transfer is complete, you can validate it immediately.
If you have a partial quantity, update the quantity on the line and validate it. The system will automatically create a backorder for the remaining items.

template.p: You can easily invoice clients directly from a Sales Order. Each order allows you to set specific payment terms and conditions tailored to that client or project.

When you're ready, you have the flexibility to create an invoice for either a full or a partial payment, such as a down payment. All invoices generated are tracked and can be managed through the Invoices app.

You can easily tailor your website to provide the information you want for potential leads. When a client contacts you through the contact page, their submission will automatically create a new opportunity in your CRM pipeline.
